PhyMediumComments: black-and-white: Ansco Superpan Press safety film
CatDescriptText: Mr. John HIll, 7121 Frankstown Avenue, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 4, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "Do you believe that Negro communities actually choose their leaders or do they accept the leadership, which 'the powers-that-be' select and 'hand' to them?" answer reads: "I think, more than likely, the Negro community accepts leaders selected by the powers-that-be."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of John HIll wearing eyeglasses, plaid shirt, and dark overcoat, standing with Pittsburgh Courier reporter in front of building with ornamental metalwork
